text: Derbyshire County Cricket Club was founded (created) in 1870. Its team plays in first-class cricket matches. Derbyshire won the County Championship in 1936. The club represents the county of Derbyshire in the East Midlands of England. Most of its home matches are played at the County Ground in the city of Derby. The club has used numerous venues around the county, including Queen's Park in Chesterfield. ==References== ==Bibliography== * Category:Derbyshire Category:First-class cricket teams in England and Wales
title: Derbyshire County Cricket Club
